title: How to Seed Files

steps.headline: Let the file you just downloaded be there in the directory you've downloaded it to.
Let your bit torrent software/client run.
steps.description: Make sure you're connected to the internet.

steps.headline: You will notice that the status is changed to 'seeding'.
steps.description: If it hasn't, then change it manually. Most bit torrent clients do it automatically.

steps.headline: Allow the file to 'seed' until your ratio reaches 1.
steps.description: A ratio of 1 means that you've 'seeded' as much as you've downloaded.

steps.headline: Continue seeding as long as you want.

text: Let the file you just downloaded be there in the directory you've downloaded it to. Do not move the file. Let your bit torrent software/client run. Make sure you're connected to the internet. You will notice that the status is changed to 'seeding'. If it hasn't, then change it manually. Most bit torrent clients do it automatically. Allow the file to 'seed' until your ratio reaches 1. A ratio of 1 means that you've 'seeded' as much as you've downloaded. Continue seeding as long as you want.
sentences: Let the file you just downloaded be there in the directory you've downloaded it to.
Let your bit torrent software/client run.
Make sure you're connected to the internet.
You will notice that the status is changed to 'seeding'.
If it hasn't, then change it manually.
Most bit torrent clients do it automatically.
Allow the file to 'seed' until your ratio reaches 1.
A ratio of 1 means that you've 'seeded' as much as you've downloaded.
Continue seeding as long as you want.
